leaflet.constituency: Gosport, Lee-on-the-Solent, Stubbington and Hill Head

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Leave the EU and get Brexit done.
Continue to prioritise local investment—need jobs, roads and schools before new houses.
Ensure our area gets our fair share of the 20,000 extra police the Conservatives have pledged to tackle crime and anti-social behaviour.
Keep pushing for better local healthcare services, improved access to GP's and reduced waiting times at QA Hospital.

mentions.candidate: I will continue to work hard for the Gosport area: fighting for our interests and making a strong voice on issues that matter to local people.
mentions.partyLeader: Included a photo with Boris Johnson.

issues.brexitEurope: Leave the EU and get Brexit done.
issues.environment: Continued to campaign against major housing developments on our green fields and open spaces.
issues.health: Keep pushing for better local healthcare services, improved access to GP's and reduced waiting times at QA Hospital.

housing.content: Continue to prioritise local investment—need jobs, roads and schools before new houses.

leaflet.personalStatement: I will continue to work hard for the Gosport area: fighting for our interests and making a strong voice on issues that matter to local people.

politicalExperience.achievements: Delivered a £70 million Enterprise Zone at Daedalus, with new businesses and colleges generating hundreds of jobs & training places. Secured the long term future of HMS Sultan and championed armed forces welfare, winning medals for the WW2 Arctic Convoy Veterans. Supported local jobs and training to see unemployment reduced by 30% since 2010, and over 1,800 apprenticeships per year. Secured over £110 million investment in local roads, including the new Gosport access road (Stubbington Bypass). Continued to campaign against major housing developments on our green fields and open spaces. Helped secure Government funding for the 200 extra police officers which Hampshire Constabulary are recruiting and training this year. Supported a successful QA Hospital bid to secure £58 million to improve A&E services for local people.
